name: code-in-folder
title: Code in New Folder
description: Open new projects in your preferred editor
author: benzipperer

commands.name: code-in-new-folder
commands.title: Code in New Folder
commands.subtitle: Create and open a project folder
commands.description: Creates a folder in your configured base directory and opens it in your preferred code editor

preferences.name: programName
preferences.title: Preferred Editor
preferences.description: Select the editor to open projects with

preferences.name: customEditorCommand
preferences.title: Custom Editor Command
preferences.description: The command to run when 'Other' is selected (e.g., vim, emacs, nano, or any editor command)

preferences.name: runCustomEditorInTerminal
preferences.title: Run Custom Editor in Terminal
preferences.label: Open custom editor inside a terminal window
preferences.description: When enabled, the custom editor command will be run inside a terminal. Useful for terminal-based editors like vim, emacs, or nano.

preferences.name: basePath
preferences.title: Base Directory Path
preferences.description: The base directory where folders will be created. Leave empty to use home directory. Supports ~ for home, relative paths, or absolute paths like / or /projects

preferences.name: addYearToPath
preferences.title: Add Year to Path
preferences.label: Add year subdirectory to base path
preferences.description: When enabled, creates folders in YEAR/MM-DD/TITLE structure. When disabled, uses MM-DD/TITLE or just TITLE structure.

preferences.name: addMonthDayToPath
preferences.title: Add Month-Day to Path
preferences.label: Add month-day subdirectory to base path
preferences.description: When enabled, creates folders with MM-DD subdirectory. When disabled with year enabled, uses YEAR/TITLE structure.

preferences.name: pathNameCase
preferences.title: Path Name Case Conversion
preferences.description: Choose how to format the folder name. 'none' uses the title as-is, other options convert case and remove special characters.

preferences.name: truncatePathName
preferences.title: Truncate Path Name
preferences.label: Limit title length
preferences.description: When enabled, limits the title to 50 characters or 10 words. When disabled, uses the full title.

preferences.name: openExistingFolder
preferences.title: Open Existing Folders
preferences.label: Open folder if it already exists
preferences.description: When enabled, opens existing folders instead of showing an error. When disabled, shows an error if the folder already exists.

preferences.name: openSpecificFile
preferences.title: Open Specific File
preferences.label: Open a specific file in the folder
preferences.description: When enabled, opens a specific file within the newly created folder instead of just the folder.

preferences.name: specificFileName
preferences.title: Specific File Name
preferences.description: The name of the file to open within the folder (e.g., main.py, index.html, README.md)
